subject: Re: How to get test's name in JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... Gabriel is ... } }); Without the name I ll have to rewrite the tests to a significant degree anyway, but for clarification, the programmers here have a
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent Beck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Kevin,
>
> My sense of the question was a little different. It sounds like
Gabriel is
> using the name field to store a file name. In JUnit 4 there is no name
> field.
>
> @Parameters
> public static Collection<Object[]> data() {
> return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] { { "file1" }, { "file2"
} });

Without the name I'll have to rewrite the tests to a significant
degree anyway, but for clarification, the programmers here have a
bunch of SQL data files named for the test case they're intended to be
used with.

So for an example test of "testPaymentDAO", the setUp function opens a
connection to a database, grabs and runs
"/some/directory/PaymentDAO-setup.sql" to prep the db, the
"testPaymentDAO" test is run, then in tearDown they grab and run the
correlating tear-down file "/some/directory/PaymentDAO-tearDown.sql"
which cleans up after them.

It seems like this particular test suite could be rewritten in a
better way anyway, as apparently they're manual tests requiring
individual user action right now due to complexities unknown to me (it
looks like you need to verify you're logged in as User V and that
table W has Records X with column Y having value Z... before running
the tests... *boggle*).
